intro: Melothria papuana, commonly known as the Papuan sour soursop, is a climbing vine native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squashes. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow when mature. The fruit is edible, though it has a tart, acidic flavor. It is often used in local cuisines for its unique taste and nutritional value.
